title: Decoding Market Structure Part 2 Bonus
description: Advanced structural concepts including inducement, liquidity raids, and HTF confluence.
content:
In this lesson, you'll learn:

• Inducement before major moves
• Liquidity raid confirmations
• Structural shift requirements
• Higher timeframe liquidity importance
• Confirmation candle requirements
• Improving probability through alignment

quiz.question: Inducement often appears before:
quiz.explanation: Inducement typically precedes major directional moves to trap unsuspecting traders.

quiz.question: Liquidity raid confirms:
quiz.explanation: Liquidity raids are when price hunts stops and grabs liquidity before reversing.

quiz.question: Structural shift requires:
quiz.explanation: A valid structural shift needs strong candle close beyond the level, not just a wick.

quiz.question: Higher timeframe liquidity is:
quiz.explanation: Higher timeframe liquidity represents stronger institutional orders and is a stronger target.

quiz.question: Structure alignment improves:
quiz.explanation: When multiple timeframes align structurally, the probability of success increases significantly.
